channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Congress Gets Something Right
item.description: The House-passed National Defense Authorization Act is an antidote to the administration’s unserious National Security Strategy.

item.title: House bill would rename D.C.'s 'Black Lives Matter Plaza' after Charlie Kirk
item.description: Rep. Nancy Mace introduced a bill to rename the former "Black Lives Matter Plaza" just north of the White House after assassinated conservative activi...

item.title: Venezuela cries 'piracy' after U.S. seizes sanctioned ship carrying bootleg oil to Iran
item.description: Venezuelan officials said the U.S. engaged in "blatant theft and an act of international piracy" after American troops seized a tanker near its coastl...

item.title: Sens. Josh Hawley, Maggie Hassan tell tech companies to crack down on AI-driven scams
item.description: Scammers are adept at using artificial intelligence to fleece people, from fake phone calls that mimic a grandparent's voice to emails that replicate ...

item.title: A San Francisco woman just gave birth in a Waymo robotaxi—and Waymo says it’s not the first time that’s happened
item.description: “We’re proud to be a trusted ride for moments big and small, serving riders from just seconds old to many years young,” Waymo said.

item.title: Leftist Wisconsin AG Is Failing To Fix The Problem He Pounded His Opponent On
item.description: Attorney General Josh Kaul won his first term on a manufactured rape kit-testing backlog scandal. Now he has the same problem and more.

item.title: Court orders DHS to release illegal immigrant Kilmar Abrego Garcia
item.description: A federal judge ordered the Trump administration on Thursday to "immediately" release Kilmar Abrego Garcia, ruling that the migrant's detention violat...

item.title: ‘Birthright Citizenship’ Is A Feudal Relic That Has No Place In America
item.description: We used to base citizenship on consent, not birth. In an era of mass immigration, it’s time to get back to that older understanding.

item.title: Netflix’s takeover of Warner Brothers is a nightmare for consumers
item.description: Netflix promotes itself as an innovator, but its skyhigh bid for Warner Brothers suggests that its trendsetter days have peaked.

item.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to Thursday's big Senate votes on healthcare
item.description: Senate votes today on competing healthcare plans to address premium spikes, but neither Republican nor Democratic proposal is expected to pass the 60-...

item.title: A DOJ That Still Chases ‘Russian Hackers’ Will Never Reckon With Russiagate
item.description: The DOJ is prosecuting the fruits of a hoax on one hand and claiming to expose the architects of that hoax on the other.

item.title: Trump slams Fed’s third-straight rate cut as ‘too small,’ saying he wishes it was twice as large
item.description: Three Fed officials dissented from the move, the most dissents in six years and a sign of deep divisions on the committee.

item.title: Returning To ‘Times New Roman,’ The State Department Learns From Cracker Barrel’s Mistakes
item.description: It would be foolish to assume the aesthetics we surround ourselves with have no effect on how we perceive the world.

item.title: Exclusive: Crypto startup LI.FI raises $29 million for cross-blockchain price discovery tool
item.description: The company aims to make moving across blockchains more efficient.

item.title: Doha Is the New Paris
item.description: Tucker Carlson finds an alluring alternative to the United States.

item.description: President Donald Trump held significantly more press conferences and media interactions than former President Joe Biden during their respective first ...

item.title: China’s Threat to the World Economy
item.description: This week’s Chinese trade numbers can leave little doubt that the country’s trade surplus is unsustainable.

item.title: On Obamacare, Trump Already Showed Republicans the Way
item.description: Senate Republicans should quit trying to expand it.

item.title: What it takes to be wealthy in America: $2.3 million, Charles Schwab says
item.description: Survey respondents said it feels like it takes more money to feel wealthy today compared to last year.

item.title: Federal judge orders Kilmar Abrego Garcia released from ICE custody
item.description: U.S. District Court Judge Paula Xinis has ordered the U.S. to release Kilmar Abrego Garcia from U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement custody.

item.title: The Idea Of ‘Birthright Citizenship’ Rests On Some Fundamental Misunderstandings
item.description: Contrary to what 'experts' and Democrats say, the 14th Amendment is anything but clear on birthright citizenship.
